title: Ways to Get Your Crush to Like You that Actually Work

steps.title: Find out what their hobbies and passions are to make a connection.
steps.content: Find out what their hobbies and passions are to make a connection. People love talking about their hobbies and interests. This includes things like making music, playing sports, reading books, and dancing. Finding out what types of things they love gives you something to talk about with them. You might even find a common interest! Dating and Relationship Coach Mark Rosenfield says talking about things that are either important to you or important to your crush creates a really good conversational vibe. [1] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. For example, maybe they’re passionate about volunteering at a nursing home. If that’s something you’re also interested in doing, it’s the perfect subject for you to talk about. Ask them directly what they’re interested in. For a less direct approach, try asking one of their friends what they like. If all else fails, check out their social media profiles.

steps.title: Ask them open-ended questions to learn more about who they are.
steps.content: Ask them open-ended questions to learn more about who they are. This is one of the best ways to show someone you’re interested while establishing a strong connection. Ask them about their family, pets, hobbies, or any other topic that helps you get to know them, says Rosenfield. [2] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. This shows that you’re engaged and interested in their life. [3] X Research source Zinn suggests trying to be non-judgemental. She says to be open and receptive to what they say. They have ideas that come from different places, but their points of view are valid and important and deserve to be listened to. [4] X Expert Source Adina Zinn, MPA Certified Career & Life Coach Expert Interview. 30 March 2022. For example, you might ask them what they’d like to study in college, what makes them the happiest, or what they like about playing the guitar. Asking questions also opens the door to them asking questions about your life so you get to know each other on a deeper level.

steps.title: Listen when they talk so they know you’re interested in what they say.
steps.content: Listen when they talk so they know you’re interested in what they say. Active listening involves focusing on your crush when they’re talking. Give them your full attention, and wait for your turn to talk. Try to remember things they’ve told you to show that you truly do listen and want to hear more of what they have to say. [5] X Research source Practice active listening by making eye contact and nodding appropriately when they’re speaking to you. If you're speaking to them over text or social media, try to respond to their messages in a timely manner. Think about what they said before sending your reply.

steps.title: Spend lots of time together to help build attraction.
steps.content: Spend lots of time together to help build attraction. The more time you spend around someone, the more likely they will be attracted to you. Rosenfield recommends asking them to spend more one-on-one time by going out to do exciting or inspiring things.” [6] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. Go to an amusement park or museum (if they enjoy art). Try to hang out with your crush as much as possible, whether it’s in a large group, with just a few other friends, or alone. [7] X Research source Try doing different activities when you’re with each other, like going to a movie , hanging out in a park with friends, or even just sitting together at lunch. If they’re always hanging around with friends, suggest a group activity with you and your friends. Host a game night or sing karaoke. Any event that you’re both interested in works. If the two of you are friends who hang out a couple of times a month, ask them to spend time once a week. Or go somewhere at night, like dinner or a movie.

steps.title: Share your unique interests and opinions to show them your true self.
steps.content: Share your unique interests and opinions to show them your true self. Don’t pretend to be someone you’re not or fake interest in what they like just so your crush will like you. When you’re being your true self , you’ll seem more confident and relaxed than you would if you were faking it. This makes it more likely your crush will be attracted to you, says Rosenfield. [8] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. Don’t forget to share your hobbies and passions with your crush!

steps.title: Show them your playful side with jokes and funny stories.
steps.content: Show them your playful side with jokes and funny stories. If your crush sees you having a good time, they’ll be more likely to want have fun with you, says Rosenfield. [9] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. Try telling your crush funny stories about yourself. Or just be laid-back and goofy around them to show your humorous side. [10] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source Show off your wit or save your best jokes for when you’re hanging out or texting with your crush. Reader Poll: We asked 2749 wikiHow readers to tell us which qualities make a person most attractive to them, and 56% said charm and a sense of humor (keep that in mind while you work on winning your crush's heart). [Take Poll]

steps.title: Be mysterious by letting them get to know you a little bit at a time.
steps.content: Be mysterious by letting them get to know you a little bit at a time. Instead of telling your crush everything at once, try to take it slow and let them learn about you in small tidbits. And make sure you have other stuff going on in your life. Dating Coach Cher Gopman says, “Coming off as too available is actually going to turn that other person away. So you want to make sure you leave a little bit to mystery.” [11] X Expert Source Cher Gopman Dating Coach Expert Interview. 17 May 2019. Remember, constantly talking about yourself may overwhelm your crush. Instead, space out the information you tell them, making them want to hear more about you. [12] X Research source If your crush asks you a question about your life, like “What’s your favorite thing to do in your free time?” answer and then ask your crush a question to keep the conversation flowing naturally.

steps.title: Be there for them when they need help or just need to talk.
steps.content: Be there for them when they need help or just need to talk. The best relationships start as strong friendships. Focus on being the best friend you can be. Support them by doing things like cheering at a game if they’re on the basketball team, helping them study for a test, or getting them a treat when they’re feeling down. [13] X Research source Let your crush tell you all about their bad day, an exciting achievement, or whatever else is on their mind. Stay focused on them and ask follow-up questions like, “How did that make you feel?” or “What did you do next?” Certified Career & Life Coach Adina Zinn recommends getting rid of distractions to better focus on what your crush is saying to you. She says, “Turn off all the notifications, put away your phone, and maybe try to clear your mind.” [14] X Expert Source Adina Zinn, MPA Certified Career & Life Coach Expert Interview. 30 March 2022.

steps.title: Keep yourself neat, clean, and smelling good.
steps.content: Keep yourself neat, clean, and smelling good. Good hygiene involves doing things like brushing your teeth , showering, and putting on deodorant. Keep your body clean by washing your face daily and lathering with soap when you shower. When you take care of your body, you’ll look and feel more attractive. [15] X Research source Wash your hair every couple of days, using conditioner after you shampoo if desired. Wear clean clothes daily to ensure you look and smell fresh. Laundry & Cleaning Specialist Rani Gorgis recommends starting with a good laundry detergent to make sure your clothes smell good and then using dryer sheets to help keep clothes fresh longer. [16] X Expert Source Rani Gorgis Laundry & Cleaning Specialist Expert Interview. 7 April 2021.

steps.title: Dress in clothing that shows off your personal style.
steps.content: Dress in clothing that shows off your personal style. Gopman says, “I'd say dress casual, but [in] something that shows off your best self, something that you feel confident in and you think you look good in.” [17] X Expert Source Cher Gopman Dating Coach Expert Interview. 17 May 2019. Try not to wear certain clothes just because they’re in fashion or you think your crush would like them. Pick out clothes you feel confident in, and that reflect your personality. [18] X Research source For dances or special occasions, pick trendy clothes you truly like and that fit well. Wear fitted jeans and a t-shirt with a picture of your favorite band or book to show your interests.

steps.title: Stand up straight with your chin up and shoulders back.
steps.content: Stand up straight with your chin up and shoulders back. Gopman says to take a deep breath, lift your shoulders, and stand up straight to relax, which gives you natural energy. [19] X Expert Source Cher Gopman Dating Coach Expert Interview. 17 May 2019. Plus, you’ll look more attractive and feel more confident if you have great posture . Sit or stand up straight, and avoid crossing your arms in front of you. Crossing your arms over your chest gives the impression you’re closed off to the conversation and the other person. Avoid hunching over when walking or sitting at a table.

steps.title: Smile to show you’re a friendly person.
steps.content: Smile to show you’re a friendly person. A natural smile brightens your entire look, making it a simple way to help attract your crush. It’s also a great way to flirt with your crush without being too obvious. Try to smile more often when you’re around your crush, even if you’re not directly talking to them. It makes you look and feel naturally happier…which is always a good look! [20] X Research source For example, smile at your crush if you see them in the hallway, or give them a smile when talking to them about their weekend plans. If you're texting your crush or using social media, try sending them a smiley face symbol or emoji.

steps.title: Hold eye contact to show your interest.
steps.content: Hold eye contact to show your interest. Rosenfield says, “So the biggest thing with eye contact is you've got to hold it a lot more than you think you do. You have to hold it for three to four seconds. And once you can do that, add a smile as well.” [21] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. When your crush looks at you, hold their gaze for a few seconds and smile before looking away. This extra eye contact hints that you like them, and it may stir up feelings inside them too. Make eye contact when you're talking with your crush. This lets them know you’re focused on them and interested in what they think.

steps.title: Lean in when you’re chatting so they know you’re listening.
steps.content: Lean in when you’re chatting so they know you’re listening. This shows you’re interested in what they’re saying or doing. Whether you’re sitting across from them at a table or standing a few feet from one another, try to lean towards them a couple of inches. This shows you’re engaged, recommends Rosenfield. [22] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. For example, if you’re sitting in class at separate desks, lean your body towards them when asking your crush a question or telling them about your day. Gopman says, “If you're leaned backward, it's showing a sign of uninterest or disinterest. If you lean forward, it's a sign of interest.” [23] X Expert Source Cher Gopman Dating Coach Expert Interview. 17 May 2019.

steps.title: Laugh at your crush’s jokes to show your sense of humor.
steps.content: Laugh at your crush’s jokes to show your sense of humor. And as you laugh , playfully and lightly tap your crush on the shoulder or rest your hand on their arm. This lets them know you're paying attention to what they are saying, says Gopman. She cautions, “You don't want to leave the hand there for too long. But if they're laughing and having a good conversation, don't be afraid to give a little touch here and there.” [24] X Expert Source Cher Gopman Dating Coach Expert Interview. 17 May 2019. Don't overdo the laughing, though. Only laugh when you genuinely find something funny, or it might seem awkward.

steps.title: Choose a time when it’s just you and your crush without distractions.
steps.content: Choose a time when it’s just you and your crush without distractions. Confess your feelings when you and your crush have a little privacy. A public declaration may work in the movies, but it puts pressure on the other person. They may feel awkward and uncomfortable even if they like you back. Invite your crush somewhere, like a quiet coffee shop or out for a walk. Then, when you both feel comfortable and relaxed, confess how you feel about them. [25] X Research source Make sure you have their full attention. Don’t confess your feelings if they’re in a bad mood or stressed out.

steps.title: Be honest and direct when you tell them how you feel.
steps.content: Be honest and direct when you tell them how you feel. Express your feelings authentically by starting your sentences with “I.” That way, you take ownership of your emotions, which makes them seem more genuine. [26] X Research source Be sincere and direct so your crush won’t misunderstand what you’re saying. Say something like, “We’ve been spending more time together lately. I’ve been having so much fun. I really like you and want to be more than just friends.” Avoid making a joke of it or acting too casual by saying something like, “Love ya!” Being honest about your feelings is good for you, even if the other person doesn’t feel the same way. [27] X Research source So, give yourself a pat on the back for being brave!

steps.title: Write a note or email if you feel anxious or shy about talking face to face.
steps.content: Write a note or email if you feel anxious or shy about talking face to face. If you're very shy, you may feel better confessing your feelings with a note. Consider writing your crush a note and leaving it somewhere, like their locker or desk. Or send your crush an email to tell them how you feel. [28] X Research source For example, write something like, “Hey, I'm really shy, so it’s hard for me to say this, but I wanted you to know I have feelings for you.” Make sure to mention that you’re writing them a note instead of talking to them face to face because you’re shy. Sometimes, a crush may be offended or think you aren’t serious if you write a note instead of just talking to them. Don’t send an anonymous note. It defeats the purpose of confessing your feelings, because they don’t know who’s writing the note. An anonymous note can backfire if your crush assumes the letter is from someone else.

steps.title: Ask them out on a date if they express interest in you.
steps.content: Ask them out on a date if they express interest in you. Rosenfield recommends using the things you’ve learned about them to get ideas for dates. [29] X Expert Source Mark Rosenfeld Dating & Relationship Coach Expert Interview. 11 June 2021. For example, if your crush told you they love a certain musician, you might ask them to go to see them in concert. If you can’t tell if your crush likes you back or they’re giving mixed signals, the best thing to do is ask them directly how they feel. Say something like, “I don’t want to pressure you or anything, but do you think you might be interested in going out with me?” or “I really like you, and I’m curious to know how you feel about me.”

steps.title: Don’t take it personally if they don’t like you back.
steps.content: Don’t take it personally if they don’t like you back. Rejection is hard, but you can’t control their emotions. If they aren’t interested in dating you, that’s okay. You’ve built a great friendship. Stay true to yourself, and keep putting yourself out there until you find someone who realizes how great you are. [30] X Research source Just because this person didn’t like you “that way” doesn’t mean someone else won’t. The way you handle rejection says a lot about you as a person. Demonstrate how amazing you are by handling it with grace and showing your crush respect.
